page.title: 12GEOLOGICAL FEATURES
page.content: In the south east corner is a fault showing as almost vertical rock named{ {Rivelin Rocks.}An interesting feature here is {Rivelin Needle},a rock column detached from the cliff by 4 metres. This stack is not visible until within a hundred metres of it since it appears from most angles to be part of the cliff face. Not far south of the A57 road,is {Head {Stone,}a weathered small rock column but easily seen from the road. Parts of the moorland,especially to the west,are topped by small tors of gritstone.
